product_name: LanolipsStrawberry 101 Ointment Multi-Balm - Dry Lips Treatment
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeLanolips took their iconic Original 101 Ointment and infused it with Vitamin E & natural strawberry fruit extract in the Lips 101 Ointment Strawberry Multi-Balm. They call it *A little tube of magic* For extremely dry & chapped lips, skin patches, cuticles & elbows.
details: DetailsBenefitsThe added strawberry extract contains alpha-hydroxy acids, which helps slough off dead cells so that new, healthy skin is revealed.This super rich, 100% natural lip balm penetrates & seals in moisture to give extreme hydration for extremely dry and chapped lips.As its name suggests, it has many uses beyond just lips.101 Uses include: Apply to dry cuticles/cracked heels/dry nasal passages. Melt it into your own moisturizer to supercharge. Mix a tiny bit with your foundation for a natural, dewy look. Keep eyebrows in place. Apply to windburn/cold-chapped cheeks. Heal dry/brittle nails, paper cuts, insect bites.Alleviate dryness associated with psoriasis and eczema.FeaturesMulti-Award Winning - Won ELLE Magazine's International Beauty AwardFemale-Owned Beauty BrandNew Mom Friendly - Safe enough for newborn babiesTSA-Approved, travel friendly beauty productDermatologically TestedCruelty-FreeCertified by Leaping BunnyVegetarian100% NaturalFormulated WithoutArtificial ColorsFragrancesParabensPthalatesPetrolatumPEGsMineral OilItem 2549504How To UseWarm the ointment between the fingers or apply directly onto the lips & skin. Use generously.Precautions: For external use only.IngredientsLanolin*, Flavour (Aroma)*, Carthamus Tinctorious (Safflower) Seed Oil*, Fragaria Vesca (Strawberry) Fruit Extract*, Tocopherol (Vit E)*. *Naturally Derived
how_to_use: Warm the ointment between the fingers or apply directly onto the lips & skin. Use generously.Precautions: For external use only.

reviews.headline: My lips feel great!
reviews.comments: My lips have never felt better.  I have a little trouble adjusting to the amount of product to put on my lips because a little goes a long way. When I have any left over, I put it on my cuticles! Softens those as well.

reviews.headline: Must have
reviews.comments: First use I fell in love! It's such a good product!

reviews.headline: review
reviews.comments: product has so many uses and heals chapped lips so fast

reviews.headline: Smells delicious and works so well
reviews.comments: This is truly one of the best lip balms I have ever used!

reviews.headline: Multi use and smells so good!
reviews.comments: I love that you can use this anywhere and the scent is so good! It doesn't smell fake and actually hydrates my lips and dry skin.

reviews.headline: Nourishing Lip Treatment
reviews.comments: This balm is excellent at locking in moisture and making my lips look healthy. It immediately heals dry lips and has a very pleasant strawberry flavor.

reviews.headline: Obsessed
reviews.comments: This smells sooo good and makes my lips so soft. The packaging is so cute too!

reviews.headline: not bad
reviews.comments: i think it does tbe trick. it keeps my lips moisturized and looks a little glossy but i hate the applicator. its so weird its like a big hole where rhe product comes out so it feels weird rubbing it on my lips instead of me squeezing the product onto my finger then rubbing it on my lips which feels like a hassle.  otherwise its decent

reviews.headline: Beautiful Hydration
reviews.comments: This has the most gorgeous scent. Not only does it have lots of peptides its great for any time of day. It gives my lips the look and feel i love without being sticky or clumpy.

reviews.headline: Love this versatile balm!
reviews.comments:
Love this balm so much! It definitely works well for dry cracked lips. I use this more as a lip mask at night and I find that it'll still be on my lips in the morning! The texture is pretty thick, but feels very nourishing, reminds me of petroleum jelly. 

I will definitely be repurchasing!

reviews.headline: Love this product!
reviews.comments: The smell is so good, and I use it on my lips every day. Worth every dollar!

reviews.headline: Turns SOLID WHITE in Cold Temp
reviews.comments: I love Lanolips, it's moisturizing and last even when exposed to water or any type of liquid. The only issue is it turns a solid white color on lips when exposed to cold temperatures meaning the AIR CONDITIONING, cold water or being exposed to cool temps environnements.

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again and again
reviews.comments: My favourite lip balm and it smells so good!

reviews.headline: Like lanolin for new mothers but smells nice
reviews.comments: I love this lip balm. The texture is like lanolin for new mothers, but the scent really elevates the experience. It really stays on your lips for a long time. It is gentle for sensitive skin. It doesn't separate at all. It can be hard to squeeze when it's cold, but it softens on the lips.

reviews.headline: I would buy it again and again!
Love
reviews.comments: Lanolips 101 is a true multitasker! Super hydrating without feeling greasy, and a little goes a long way. I use it on dry lips, cuticles, and even rough patches on my hands. It's thick but melts into the skin beautifully. Perfect for sensitive skin and has no weird scent. A staple in my skincare bag!

reviews.headline: U need this
reviews.comments: I love lanolips and its thickness but i feel its too little product ;( its just too good

reviews.headline: clumpy/ gritty
reviews.comments: I have 2 of these in 2 different flavors/ scents and both of them are gritty and clumpy, my lips feel even more dry and theyve started to break out with what looks like small white pimples all over my lips :(

faceoff_positive.comments:
I bought this after reading a beauty blog about its many uses. Also I thought it would be pretty effective since lanolin is remarkably close to our own natural skin oils. I like how the tube is small enough for my purse and is multifunctional for a variety of skin problems.
Recently I became obsessed with stocking up after I got a cold sore. Typically my sores last about 4-5 days, but the peeling, open wound lasts for 10 or more days. I never pick or peel, but the skin around the sore is extremely dry and always cracking and bleeding. When healing is complete, I'm always left with a small scar. I've tried lots of ointments, balms and lip masks, but I'll still wake up on the next morning with dry lips and a fresh scab. 
This lovely smelling ointment with no taste would stay on my lips overnight, so there was never a scab covered crack in my lip and my sore healed quickly. 
I found out that there are other fruit scented ones (luv the smell of fruit) like apple, pear and peach, available in Australia and I'm planning on paying the extra $$ to have them shipped to me.
faceoff_positive.headline: Wonderful  multipurpose balm

faceoff_negative.comments:
It smells good and feels nice when the temperature is just right.  Why do I mention temperature?  Because it's very sensitive to it.  if you leave it in your pocket or car and it warms up, the contents get runny, the packaging will blurt out way too much and it feels slimy.  The hole in the applicator is too big so way too much comes out and it's wasteful. 

And lets say you leave it in the car when it's cold and put it on, as I did.  If you can manage to get it out of the tube, it's like smearing thick grease on your lips and it will look whitish and gross.  I was mortified when I caught a glimpse of myself after having just applied this before getting out of my car to talk to someone. I looked like a drooly kid who had just woken up with goo smeared all over my lips. 

For as expensive as this is (for a lip balm) I wouldn't expect to have so many obvious issues with it.  Maybe better packaging would remedy some of the issues because as it is, it's difficult to regulate the amount of product.  Who want to go through a pricey tube of balm in half the time just because of packaging issues?
faceoff_negative.headline: Wouldn't buy again
